1.content:
If anyone else had been in the garage, they would’ve heard Dominic Harrison having a lively argument with his fiancé Rebecca Northam. They also wouldn’t have been surprised, as these arguments had become a regular occurrence for Dominic and Rebecca.

“I’m at my wits end with you, Dom.” Stopping in the middle of the garage, her face red with anger, Rebecca said, “I go to all this trouble to get us an extra week in Miami; and suddenly you decide not to come?”

The company that Rebecca and Dominic both worked for, Northam Technologies, was spearheading project designed to predict the formation of hurricanes with greater accuracy. Rebecca, as the head of Media Relations, was holding a news conference in Miami announcing the start of the project. They both agreed, weeks ago, that they would spend an extra week down there as a vacation. “Oh please, you had no trouble getting us that extra vacation time.” Hurrying to catch up with Rebecca, Dominic said, “Your family owns the company, you could’ve asked for a month off and they’d give it to you.”

As she arrived at their car, still fuming, Rebecca said, “That’s not the point, Dom; you always find some reason to weasel yourself out of everything.”

“What do you want me to say, Becca; I didn’t want to come to Miami in the first place.” Angrily opening the driver’s side door, Dominic said, “This time of year, do you have any idea how hot it’ll be? I’d rather stay up here New York.”

Rebecca expected Dominic to turn the car on and leave once she climbed inside. Instead, he just sat there staring out the windshield. Looking at him, Rebecca said, “What’s wrong with us, Dom? All we’ve been doing lately is argue with each other.”

“I-I don’t know, Becca.” Sighing as he started the car, Dominic turned to look at Rebecca. “I think we’re just stressed; with work and planning the wedding.”

“Yeah,” muttering under breath, Rebecca said, “The wedding you want to postpone again.”

“Can we not start that argument again; I told you last night why I think we should postpone the wedding.” Sighing, Dominic continued, “I think we should wait until we’re able to pay for more of it ourselves; and not have to rely on your uncle.”

Rebecca’s Uncle Harold, who was the company’s CEO, had pretty much raised Rebecca and her sister after their parents died. While Rebecca was just old enough to remember her parents, Harold was the closest thing she had to a father. “And I told you, Uncle Harold would see it as a slap in the face if we sidestep his offer to pay for the wedding.”

“Then I don’t know what we should do, Becca.” Sighing as he drove out of the parking garage, Dominic said, “We should sit down with your uncle when you’re back, maybe we can get him to see reason.”

****************


It was around a 25-minute drive to the business park that housed the corporate headquarters for Northam Technologies. After giving each other a quick kiss, Rebecca and Dominic went their separate ways. Rebecca took the elevator up to the 9th floor and walked down to the end of the hall. Entering the reception area, she waved at the receptionist behind the desk, “Morning Carolyn, is he in there?”

“Morning Ms. Northam; he’s a little busy at the moment.”

Carolyn didn’t bat an eye as Rebecca continued through the next set of doors. Must be nice, she thought, being related to the owner of the company. Meanwhile, Rebecca saw her uncle sitting behind his desk looking at something on his computer. Looking up, Harold Northam smiled and said, “Good morning, sweetheart.” Getting up from behind his desk, Harold gave Rebecca a hug and said, “Shouldn’t you and Dominic be on a plane to Miami?”

“The flight isn’t for a few hours; and now Dominic’s not coming.”

Seeing the pained expression on his niece’s face, Harold gestured for her to sit on the couch. Taking a seat next to her, he said, “You two had another argument, didn’t you?”

“Last night, and it was a nasty one.” Sighing, Rebecca said, “Dominic wants to postpone the wedding until we can pay for it ourselves. I tried to tell him that you wouldn’t like that, but he insisted.”

Harold never particularly cared for Dominic, and this was something that Rebecca was aware of. He thought that she could do so much better than some lowly IT technician; one who, despite having a decent work ethic, had no sense of ambition. Rebecca was also an attractive young woman, a champion gymnast in High School, while Dominic was a little on the pudgy side. “Has it ever occurred to you, honey, that perhaps money isn’t really the reason Dominic wants to postpone?” looking at Rebecca, Harold said, “What if this is his way of backing out of the engagement; putting up enough obstacles until you’ve had enough and called it quits.”

“Not this again, Uncle Harold; regardless of what you think of him, Dominic isn’t the type to just walk away.”

“I’ll tell you what I can do.” Placing a sympathetic hand on Rebecca’s lap, Harold said, “I can speak with Dominic, to try and knock some sense into him.”

“I appreciate the offer, Uncle. But,” looking at her uncle, Rebecca said, “I doubt there’s anything you can say that will get through to him.”

“Trust me, Rebecca; I have my ways.” Reaching over to hug his niece, with a sly smile on his face, Harold said, “You’d be surprised at what I can do.”
1.title: How It All Started

11.content:
An hour had gone by since he’d arrived at work, and Dominic was certain that Rebecca had left for the airport by now. He tried sending her a few apology texts but she either didn’t see them or was refusing to respond. He was about to send out another text when he sensed someone standing behind him.

Turning around, his heart skipped a beat when he saw Rebecca’s Uncle Harold standing at the entrance to his cubicle. “M-Mr. Northam, w-what a pleasant surprise.”

“Rebecca came to see me an hour ago; she told me how you two had an argument last night.” Walking into the cubicle, Harold said, “Rebecca and her sister are like daughters to me; so when Rebecca comes to see me all upset, it doesn’t make me very happy.”

Dominic knew that Harold didn’t have a high opinion of him, as Harold would frequently say that Rebecca should find someone better. “Look sir, I-I love Rebecca more than anything; but I want to prove to her, and you, that I can provide for her on my own.”

“How do you expect to do that working as a lowly IT technician?” scoffing, Harold said, “Rebecca deserves to be with someone who has the drive to move up in the world. You’ve worked for this company for 3 years, and you’ve turned down several promotions.”

“What can I say, sir; my dad always told me that money isn’t important, so long as you’re doing something you love.”
Before Harold could respond, they were interrupted by a young pregnant woman with a buzz cut. “Hey Dom, can you help me with something really quick?”

Dominic took one look at Harold before turning back to the coworker. “Sure thing, Marci.”

Harold waited until Dominic and Marci were out of sight; reaching into his pocket, he pulled out a small vial. Opening the top, he poured the contents into Dominic’s coffee mug. “I’m sorry, Dominic. But,” returning the now empty vial to his pocket, Harold said, “I’m certain this will help give you some perspective.”

Dominic returned a few minutes later, looking mildly annoyed about something. “I’m sorry to cut this short, Harold; but something’s come up.” Grabbing his mug and laptop, Dominic said, “There’s an issue down in one of the labs that I need to look at.”

“Don’t apologize Dominic, I won’t take up any more of your time.” Getting to his feet, Harold said, “Promise me you’ll think about what I said; alright?”
11.title: Harold Pays Dominic A Visit

111.content:
Dominic followed Marci as they stepped off the elevator onto the R&D floor. After finishing off the last of his coffee, he said, “So what’s the problem exactly?”

“There’s something wrong with one of the decontamination showers. Apparently,” putting her access card against a reader, Marci said, “It’s not opening once the decontamination cycle is completed. One of the techs had to be set home, as the experience triggered a claustrophobia-induced panic attack.”

After meeting with the remaining lab tech, Marci and Dominic entered a changing area next to the showers. Rather than risk putting Marci in a potentially dangerous, as well as embarrassing, situation Dominic agreed to be the guinea pig. Once he’d changed into a pair of boxers to protect his modesty, he stepped inside and signaled Marci to start the cycle.

Almost as soon as the shower door closed, Dominic was hit with the worst cramps he’d ever experienced in his life. It was almost like his insides were on fire. With no other options, he hit the panic button. Dominic’s pain grew exponentially worse as the alarms started blaring outside. It seemed to be spreading through his body. His last thoughts before losing consciousness were of Rebecca.

******************************


The crews arrived in near record time, running into the room to find Marci making a feeble attempt to open the door. “What happened?”

“I-I don’t know.” Trying to remain calm, Marci said, “He started to scream and then he hit the panic button. That’s all I know.”

The rescue crew finally managed to open the door and go inside. Seeing a figure lying prone on the floor, they said, “Are you alright,…sir?

The figure on the floor sat up. From Marci’s description they’d expected to see a man. However, while the figure was wearing a set of men’s boxers, she was most definitely a woman.

“Thank goodness you’re here.” Looking up at the men of the rescue crew, running a hand through her wet hair, the woman said, “That was quite an experience, let me tell you.”
111.title: The Rise of Dominique

1111.content:
Marci remained with Dominic as he...she was brought to a nearby room to be examined, her reasoning equal parts concern and curiosity. After all, it wasn’t every day that someone you worked closely with for 3 years suddenly becomes a woman. Despite being a woman herself, Marci was asked to wait outside while a company physician did a thorough examination.

She passed the time by giving a statement to the rescue team, who were just as confused once they realized Marci hadn’t mistakenly said Dominic was a man. It wasn’t long before the closed door opened, and the doctor stepped out. Looking at Marci and the guards, she said, “The patient is ready for visitors; but not all at once.”

Moving as quickly as her pregnancy would allow her, Marci entered the room to find Dominic stepping out of the bathroom while buttoning his shirt. Dominic looked up at her with a wry smile on his face, “Hey Marci,” doing a little spin, Dominic continued, “What do you think?”

Without saying a word, or asking if it was alright, Marci walked over and placed her hands against Dominic’s chest. “Y-You’re a woman? H-How is that possible?”

Acting surprisingly calm given the circumstances, Dominic said, “She doesn’t know for sure, but the doctor things I was exposed to something.”

Growing concerned, Marci said, “You’re surprisingly calm about this whole thing, Dom.”

“I don’t see what the big deal is.” Looking at her appearance in the mirror, her voice becoming bolder, Dominic said, “I think I look pretty good for a 38-year-old woman.”

Even Marci had to admit that Dominic made a rather good-looking woman – tall, slender frame with not an ounce of fat. She was about to comment about that, when she realized what Dominic had just said, “Wait a minute...38 years old?”

“I know, right; I don’t look a day over 32.” Sitting down on the exam bed, Dominic said, “Apparently whatever changed me into a woman also made me 13 years older.”

Marci, once again, was beginning to question why Dominic was so calm about this. Before she could ask him about that, the doctor re-entered the room. “Well Mr. Harrison, you’ve certainly given me quite a mystery to solve.” Looking at Dominic, she said, “I’m no closer to figuring out what caused this; but my preliminary tests show that you’re healthy and not a threat to others.”

Getting to his feet, with a smile, Dominic said, “That’s great news, doctor; I assume that means I’m free to go?”

“I see no reason to keep you here; I’ll call you if I find anything.”

As Dominic started towards the door, Marci stepped in front to stop him. Thrown off by the contemptuous look on Dominic’s face, Marci turned her attention to the doctor. “Doc, I’m not sure it’s smart to let Dominic go just yet.” Ignoring the annoyed groan from Dominic, Marci continued, “I think there is something wrong with him; if you found yourself turned into an older man, would you be this calm?”

“Look Doc, you said I was fine; it’s probably just shock.” Dominic turned around to defend himself, “I’m sure I’ll start freaking out once I get home and explain everything to Rebecca.”

The doctor had to admit that she’d shared some of Marci’s concerns; she wouldn’t be this calm in a situation like this, but people handle situations differently. Having other pressing things to do, including writing a report on this, the doctor said, “If you experience any unusual behavior, call me immediately.”

The doctor walked out of the room, leaving Dominic alone with Marci. She blocked him again as he tried to move towards the door. “Look Marci, I know you’re just being a good friend; but back off.” gently pushing her aside, Dominic said, “Now’s my chance to have a little fun without that loser holding me back, and I intend to take full advantage of it.”

Marci tried to protest, but Dominic left the room before she could say anything. She’d worked closely with Dominic for almost 3 years; the only person who knew him better than her was Rebecca. She knew there was something wrong with him but couldn’t put her finger on it.

Dominic beat a hasty retreat towards the exit, having no urge to stick around longer than she had to. Contrary to what everyone else thought, Dominic was experiencing an unforeseen side effect. Not only had he been transformed into an older woman, but another personality was slowly taking control. With a smile on her face, ‘Dominic’ walked through the parking garage to where the car was parked. “God,” chuckling as she climbed into the car, ‘Dominic’ said, “It was almost too easy convincing those two that I was loser Dominic.”

This new personality couldn’t care less about what caused her to come into existence; all she cared about was taking advantage of the situation while she could. Time to have myself a little fun, driving out of the parking garage, the woman said, and Dominic can’t stop me.
1111.title: Deception and Subterfuge

11113.content:
Harold was back in his office, once more looking over some financial reports, when he was alerted to a new email. Looking up at the screen, he saw that it was nothing more than an incident report. He’d made it policy to include him in every email about an incident anywhere in the company. He didn’t normally read them, but this time something told him he should.

He barely skimmed the email before he was on his feet and running out the door. He ran down the stairs so fast his feet barely touched the floor. Running into the IT department, he saw Dominic’s coworker sitting at her desk. “Where’s Dominic?”

“The doctor sent him home, sir.” Sighing, Marci said, “I didn’t think it was a smart idea, but she overruled me.”

The IT department was woefully understaffed right now, so Marci was the only one in the room. “A grown man turns into a woman, and she sends him home?” leaning against the cubicle to catch his breath, Harold said, “Did she say anything about what may have caused such a radical transformation?”

“No sir, she didn’t.” Getting to her feet, Marci walked over to the water cooler. Pouring a cup of water, she returned and handed it to Harold. “There’s something that probably wasn’t included the report, sir – Dominic seemed very calm under the circumstances.”

Sipping the water, Harold said, “What do you mean?”

“I’ve known Dominic for a few years now, and he doesn’t react very well to surprises.” Sitting back down, Marci said, “So when I see him barely batting an eye to the fact he’s turned into a woman, I know something is wrong.”

Taking his cellphone from his pocket, Harold dialed Dominic’s cellphone number. It rang once before going to voicemail. “Dominic, it’s Harold Northam; please call me back immediately.”

Seeing the worried look on Harold’s face, Marci said, “I wouldn’t worry sir, he’s probably too busy processing all this with Rebecca.”

“Rebecca’s on a flight to Miami, Ms. Pendleton; she left an hour ago.” Seeing the color drain from Marci’s face, he said, “Why, what’s wrong?”

Marci was playing back the conversation with Dominic in her mind; she was certain that he said he was going to discuss this with Rebecca. But how could that be true if she were on a plane flying to Miami. “Sir, we need to find Dominic.”

Without saying a word, Harold turned and left the room, once more dialing Dominic’s number.

***********************


Meanwhile, at strip mall across town, ‘Dominic’ saw that Harold was calling her again. After listening to the last voice mail, she figured another call was only a matter of time. Well, I guess the cat’s out of the bag now.

Turning off the cellphone, ‘Dominic’ entered a hair salon. Going up to the receptionist, she said, “Hi, I called a few minutes ago about getting my hair done.”

“Of course, ma’am; we have a few cancellations, so we can fit you right in.” typing away at her computer, the receptionist said,

“Can I have your name, please?”

“Dominique.” With a mischievous smile on her face, the woman said, “Dominique Harrison.”
11113.title: The Incident Report

111131.content:
It wasn’t long before a stylist, a woman only a few years older than her, had Dominique in sitting in a chair. As she placed an apron om Dominique to keep away the hair, the woman said, “I don’t think I’ve seen you around here before.”

“You haven’t.” focusing on the mirror, Dominique said, “I’m kind of new in town.”

“Well then, welcome to Lavish Locks; my name’s Michelle.” With a smile on her face, Michelle said, “What can I do for you today?”

“I’ve recently experienced somewhat of a rebirth.” With a devilish grin, Dominique said, “I’m basically looking for a fresh look to show off the new me.”

If Michelle was at all confused by Dominique’s frankly vague response, she didn’t say anything. How would she have any way of knowing what Dominique was really alluding to. Reaching for her scissors, Michelle said, “Everyone deserves a fresh look every now and then; so, let’s see what we can come up with.”

**********************


What Dominique assumed would take only a short while ending up taking almost 2 hours. But, as she looked at herself in the mirror, she couldn’t argue with the results that she was seeing. Michelle spent most of the time putting highlights into Dominique’s hair, following that up with a modest use of the curling iron. “Michelle, you’re a miracle worker.” Getting to her feet, Dominique leaned in to give her a hug, “This is the best my hairs looked in god knows how long.”

“I’m glad you like it, Dominique.” Leading Dominique back to the counter, Michelle said, “Now all you need is a new outfit, and you’ll have your pick of men at the bar tonight.”

Dominique wasn’t sure how long she’d be around for; so, she knew she had to take advantage of the situation while she could. It’s probably best I have fun while I can, she thought to herself, before I go back to being that dullard. After paying Michelle for her work, and giving her a generous tip, Dominique returned to the car. As she pulled out into traffic, Dominique said to herself, “Now to go find an appropriate outfit for the evening.”
111131.title: A New Look

1111313.content:
Harold was on the phone with the police, giving them Dominic’s description, when Marci entered his office. “I appreciate the effort, officer. Please,” gesturing for Marci to have a seat, Harold said, “Call me the minute you find anything.”

Marci took a seat at Harold hung up the phone; looking at him, she said, “I just got off the phone with Rebecca & Dominic’s neighbors, they haven’t seen anyone return to the apartment since Dominic left the building.”

“Where could he have possibly disappeared too.” Leaning back in the chair, sighing, Harold said, “He’s in a completely foreign body, you’d think the first thing on his mind would be getting somewhere private.”

“As I tried to mention earlier, sir; I don’t think Dominic is in his right mind.” Pausing, Marci said, “The fact that he was suddenly an older woman didn’t seem to phase him in the slightest.”

“I suppose the next logical course of action is to speak with the lab; find out what he may have been exposed to.” Getting up, Harold said, “Once we figure that out, we can see about reversing this.”

Looking at Harold as he walked by, Marci said, “What about Rebecca, shouldn’t someone tell her what’s going on?”

“I’d rather not alarm her before we know all the facts; especially if there's even a chance we can fix this before she returns.” Stopping at the door, Harold said, “In the mean time, the police are out looking for Dominic; if they find him, they'll call me."
1111313.title: Harold Meets with Marci

11113131.content:
Dominique had no qualms against spending Dominic’s money as she entered the mall; figuring he would do the same if he were in her position. Besides, Dominique thought to herself as she rode the escalator, at least the money is finally being used for something. That wasn’t entirely true, and Dominique knew it; the money was being saved for Dominic and Rebecca’s wedding.

Stepping off the elevator, she made a beeline to one of the high-end clothing stores. Walking inside, projecting an air of confidence that Dominic could never pull off, she walked up to one of the workers. “Hello there, I’m planning a fun night on the town tonight; and I need an outfit.”

The worker, a young woman in her late teens, looked less than thrilled as she gestured towards the woman’s clothing section. “Follow me,” with no enthusiasm at all, the woman said, “I’ll show you what we’ve got.”

Dominique silently followed the woman, while internally she debated talking with the manager about her. No, thinking to herself, I’m not going to be a Karen. They were barely in the woman’s section for a minute before Dominique found a dress that she thought was perfect. It looked just the right size and would leave little to the imagination. Taking it off the rack, she said, “Which way to the changing room, I want to try this on.”

The young woman silently pointed a short distance away, before walking off. Dominique took the dress into the changing area;
entering one of the stalls, she closed the door and got undressed. It was only once she was completely naked, that she realized she was wearing men’s briefs. “Good lord,” disgusted with herself, Dominique said, “I guess I need to buy some new underwear, and possibly a few bras.”

As it turned out the dress was just the right size, if only slightly bigger than it needed to be. But it still clung snugly in all the right places, which was all she cared about. Once she was satisfied with the dress, she changed out of it and back into Dominic’s clothes. If I’m going to be sticking around, I should probably get some new clothes to wear.

After getting a pack of underwear, along with a few bras, she took her purchases to the counter. She left the mall a few minutes later, feeling better than she’d had in a long time. As she got back into the car, she thought about to do next. She figured it was only a matter of time before people started looking for her, so she couldn’t go back to the apartment. “Oh well, guess I’ll just have to get a room for the night.”

****************************


Meanwhile, at the Miami International Airport, Rebecca was getting off the plane.
11113131.title: A Shopping Spree

111131311.content:
Digging her phone from her purse, Rebecca briefly hesitated before calling Dominic’s cell phone. She wasn’t sure he was in the mood to talk with her, but she thought she’d try anyway. After the call went straight to voicemail, Rebecca thought perhaps it was her phone; until two more attempts ended the same way. “Well,” putting the phone back in the purse, Rebecca said, “He’s probably dodging my calls; I’ll give him some time to calm down.”

If only she knew what was really happening, she would’ve flown back to New York as quickly as she could. Making her way down to the baggage claim area, she spotted a chauffeur holding a sign with her name on it. Walking up to him, she said, “My name’s Rebecca Northam.”

“Welcome to Miami, Ms. Northam.” Taking her bags, the chauffeur said, “Follow me; I’ll take you to your hotel.”

Rebecca didn’t say anything as she followed the chauffeur to a waiting car; instead, she was focused on getting her mind off the fight with Dominic. She’d flown out the day before the press conference, so she had plenty of time to herself. As she got into the car, she decided that she was going to have a couple drinks and hang around the pool. That’ll get my mind of everything.
111131311.title: Arriving in Miami

1111313111.content:
Dominique knew it was only a matter of time before people started looking for her, if they hadn't already. Going back to the apartment was out of the question, so she settled on getting a hotel room. The problem with that was there was a Comic Book convention in town this weekend, Dominique knew that it would be difficult to find a room anywhere. Arriving at one of the nicer oceanfront resorts in Northern New Jersey, Dominique parked the car.

Walking into the lobby, projecting an air of confidence that Dominic wouldn’t have been able to pull off, Dominique walked up to the front desk. The clerk, a woman in her mid-20s, walked out of the office and said, “Welcome to Seaside Resort & Spa, how can I help you today?”

Sliding her card across the counter, Dominique said, “I’d like a room, please; preferably a suite but I’ll take whatever you’ve got.”

Taking the card, the clerk took one look at it and said, “This card says Dominic Harrison.”

Guess it was only a matter of time before someone got smart. “It’s alright; that’s my card too.” Licking her lips, Dominique said, “Please; I can be very...appreciative.”

The clerk smiled for a moment as she took a casual look down Dominique’s cleavage. Blushing ever so slightly, the clerk said, “Let me see what I can do.” After a few seconds passed, she said, “You’re in luck; we’ve got one suite available overlooking the pool.”

**********************************


Once she was upstairs in the room, Dominique chuckled; being only a few hours old, she wasn’t sure if she was attracted to men or women. But, as she eyed the bikini lying on her bed, she knew figuring that out was going to be fun.

After making sure she looked presentable, Dominique made her way down to the pool; flashing a flirtatious grin towards the clerk as she walked by the desk. Once on the pool deck, she ordered a Sex on the Beach from the bar and found a vacant lounge chair nearby. Between sips, she found herself enjoying the looks she was receiving from both men and women.

Around the time she’d finished her drink, she noticed an older man approaching her. He looked to be in his early 50s and, if the tan line on his ring finger was any indication, he was looking to have some fun. Taking a seat next to her, the man said,
“Hello there.”

Sitting up, Dominique smiled and said, “Hi.”

Gesturing to Dominique's empty glass, the man said, “What are you having?”

“I don’t know about you. But,” with a smile, Dominique said, “I could go for a Slow Comfortable Screw Between the Sheets.”

The man smiled back as he casually walked over to the bar to make an order. As she watched him, Dominique knew she was going to have an interesting evening.
1111313111.title: Getting A Room

11113131111.content:
Almost four hours had passed since Dominic’s accident, and Harold was no closer to figuring out where he’d run off to. Every call went to voicemail and, being that he wasn’t a cosigner, he wasn’t able to track him thru credit card purchases. He just had to put his faith in the police and hope they found him before Rebecca returned.

Entering one of the research labs, Harold walked up to one of the scientists. “Excuse me, Doctor.” Trying his best to remain calm, Harold said, “What can you tell me about Chemical XP-3?”

Turning to look at Harold, the Doctor said, “Not much sir, I’m afraid; that project was discontinued months ago.”

Already feeling uneasy about what happened, Harold’s mood worsened when he heard that. “Discontinued? What for?”

“Well sir, XP-3 was originally designed to be a behavior modifying drug for children.” Walking over to a computer, the Doctor said, “We thought it was working; until some of the lab mice started experiencing unexpected behavioral changes.”

Harold knew what XP-3 was intended to do; in fact, that was why he’d exposed Dominic to it. But hearing there were unexpected complications made him feel uneasy. “What kind of behavioral changes?”

“I was hired after the project was shelved, so I don’t know for sure.”

Harold didn’t like where this was going. “This is probably going to sound crazy; but, hypothetically, could XP-3 cause physical changes?”

“As I said, I was brought on after the project was shelved; so, I don’t know for sure.” Looking confused, the Doctor said, “If you give me some time, I can probably have an answer for you by the end of the week.”

The end of the week wasn’t good enough, Rebecca would be home by then. Harold needed an answer to this before she returned. “No, I’d like an answer by tomorrow if possible.” Sighing, he said, “If your boss asks, tell him this is a personal request from me.”

“Y-Yes sir.” As Harold turned to leave, the Doctor said, “May I ask what this all about, sir?”

“I’m afraid not, son.”
11113131111.title: Visiting the Lab

info.brief_description: A man becomes everything he is not - including a woman.
info.description:
Dominic Harrison is a 25 year old man with a problem; recently he's started transforming into a 38 year old woman without warning. To make matters were, this woman has a mind and a personality separate from Dominic's. Can the two of them find a way to coexist, or will the rise of one mean the obliteration of the other?

Rules:
1. Proper grammar and spelling.
2. There can be sex, but don't overdo it.
3. Use 3rd Person Perspective.
4. I reserve the right to edit or delete chapters.
